data.title: Good Bicycle Trail but a little dodgy
data.text: Good, paved bicycle trail with easy access to Lodo, Union Station, Highlands and RiNo. Some sections - especially around 13th street can be a little dodgy with transients and drug use.

data.title: Great bike riding path
data.text: I love riding along this path. It follows the Platte River from downtown to Chatfield Resevoir (15+ miles). Can be busy on the weekends.

data.title: Scenic Walking Trail
data.text: Although this trail runs 17.8 miles and starts in Thorton in the north and goes to Englewood in the south, we accessed the South Platte River Trail when visiting the Denver Children's Museum and started walking along the trail with a baby in a stroller, enjoying it more and more every minute. From the trail, you get a view of Elitch Gardens and Denver as you walk along the Platte River. It is tree lined much of the way so there is some shade. After passing the Denver Aquarium and continuing along the trail, you come to a bridge that crosses the Platte River and you pass through Confluence Park where Cherry Creek meets the Platte River. At this point, there is a separate bike trail on one side of the Platte and a walking trail on the other side.  As we were walking, joggers passed and there families with stroller and, people walking their pets.  We decided to exit the trail on Larimer Street- the trail is wheelchair and stroller accessible with ramps to exit along the trail so we had no problem with the stroller. The South Platte River Trail is a wonderful way to spend time with an enjoyable and interesting walk.

data.title: What a great place to spend a sunny afternoon
data.text:
A lovely way to spend a couple of hours, with a trail running both sides of the plate river, and a lot of green space with paths and sculptures ...  and a cycle track leading out of town, Great space to have right in the centre of the city

Great for a leisurely walk, a jog,  or a bike ride..

data.title: Great area to enjoy the outdoors and see water!
data.text: After growing up along the Mississippi and near many lakes, I often miss being near water.  This area gives me that fix!  There is an awesome paved trail that takes you along the river.  There is also a park and shops and restaurants not far from the trail.  It's a great place to enjoy running, biking or walking along a river!  Take a moment to relax in the patk or check out something nearby to eat.  Nice little area.

data.title: We went down after springs river levels dropped 2015 to explore!
data.text: The surprised feeling of being in another world in our own city. Very cool walk, ride and run side walks are very nice, but the high water can leave debris. they clean it up in summer. We stopped at REI and Denver Brewery too since they are in area after our walk.

data.title: Great place to go to people watch on a warm day
data.text: I have a condo that is only a stones throw from here. I love to walk over and "people watch" on warm days. They also have regular events in the area that seems to really bring things to life.

data.title: Outdoor paradise in the heart of the city
data.text: This wonderful greenway provideds miles and miles of walking, running, and cycling fun.  It can get a bit crowded, especially on warm, sunny days.  If you are on a bicycle, be aware and keep your speed safe and controllable so as not to cause conflicts, but otherwise this is a lovely space taking you into the heart of Denver at the "confluence."  Bring a picnic, try some kayaking, visit many small cafes and shops ... even get some outdoor gear at the REI store overlooking the confluence.  A great place for everyone, regardless of fitness level

data.title: Fabulous way to get downtown and get some exercise too!
data.text: The bike/rec trail goes from C470 all the way to downtown and beyond.  You can even circle the entire city and go past Cherry Creek Shopping center, down to Parker and back out to where you started via the C470 trail.  Platte River Trail is really lovely with lots of trees in most parts and a number of wonderful places to stop and have some refreshments.

data.title: Urban Walk With Company
data.text: Some lovely trails in the heart of the city.  Accessible to all.  Some areas seemed better than others....  There are some very interesting old  brick buildings along the route in this old part of the city.  I enjoyed a walk with my husband in the middle of the day.  I'm not sure that I would be comfortable in this area by myself in non-peak times.

data.title: Cool but dirty urban river - great bike paths
data.text: We walked along this very cool urban river and even put in a toe at confluence park.  But, there was a lot broken glass, hubcaps and other urban detritis in the river - not for the barefoot or small children.  The bike and walking trails along it were fantastic - a fun nature walk in the city.

data.title: Great trails
data.text: I brought my bike out for the length of time I was inDenver and this was a highlight of my trip. There are seemingly endless miles of trails that I wish I could have explored them all.

data.title: Nice walking and bicycle path along the path
data.text: We told a walk along the platte river which was still running high. There are plaques along the path explains the history of the area which is interesting. You do have to watch for the bikes that sneak up behind you so you don't walk into them. We ended up at Confluence park where you usually see kayakers but there wasn't any. I guess it was because of the river running high. They are doing construction on one side of the river that will be a tiered concrete bank.

data.title: Biking and walking trail
data.text: I really enjoy doing a ride or rollerblade on this trail. I try to hit it after 4pm on the weekends, so I have a bit more room to move. It takes you north and south in Denver, and it's possible to do a decent distance on this trail. It follows the Platte River and is quite scenic in most parts.

data.title: Great biking and running/walking path.
data.text: The greenway has many other trails it connects to, making it a favorite among locals. I can ride my bike downtown and have lunch or attend a sporting event and take the light rail back. Aspen Grove/Mineral Station and Downtown Littleton are popular spots along the greenway that intersect closely to each other. If you are training for any event, running or biking, the miles that connect to the greenway are numerous. It is approximately 14 miles from Aspen Grove to downtown Denver. There are also several spots to stop and have food, beverages or visit Hudson Gardens along the way.

data.title: Took off some time during business visit to see places
data.text: The best water way I have seen. One of the best place I have ever seen. Such a beauty of water flow and thrilling experience.

data.title: Great walking. Bicycling, running trail
data.text: Trail close to hotel, but many sites to enter it. It followed the South Platte River. Scenic walking, linked with quite a few parks for people to stop and rest or eat. Good way to exercise in the heart of the city.

data.title: Great Asset to the Metro area
data.text: thousands of folks enjoy this resource, so it's very crowded on nice days, but it's a fab resource and connects to many other trails.  Always want more trails to keep us fit!  Just be away to obey the rules on right of way.  I'm still recovering from a guy pulling a kiddie trailer on his bike on a blind corner, but taking his half out of the middle.  Broke two ribs, another shoulder break, $500 damage to my wheel/tire/handlebars and $800 damage to my watch.  Not good.

data.title: Fun day out
data.text: Even though its completely busy, I recommended going on the weekends. Take your bike (or rent one of the B Cycle bikes) and bike along the path to the convergence of the two rivers. There are some restaurants nearby for lunch/brunch and people watching. Loved seeing the dogs playing in the water!

data.title: Beautiful urban trail!
data.text: Hundreds of miles of walking and biking await you on this gorgeous green way!  Thank heavens elected officials & philanthropists worked together to create this tremendous community asset.  From Confluence Park in every direction, fun is available!
